discussion.content:
Agreed AB
Local SPAN sources must be on the same host (linecard) as the destination port.

questions.question_text: Which two statements about the ACI BGP route reflector policy are true? (Choose two.)

choices.C: The ACI Fabric route reflectors use multiprotocol BGP to distribute external routes within the fabric.
choices.E: The BGP route reflector policy is configured under Fabric > Access Policies.
choices.B: Configuring route reflectors requires designating spines as route reflectors and providing the AS number.
choices.A: Route reflectors need not configure connectivity to external networks, but slight performance degradation can occur between border leaf and compute node leafs.
choices.D: The BGP route reflector domain policy autonomous system number is configured during initial the APIC setup script, but it can be modified afterward.

discussion.content:
In the Cisco Application Centric Infrastructure Fundamentals reference guide, Geolocation is
talked about in the Fabric Provisioning Chapter.
http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/aci/apic/sw/1-x/aci-fundamentals/
b_ACI-Fundamentals/b_ACI-Fundamentals_chapter_010011.html
Geolocation is the identification of the real-world geographic location of a networking device.
Geolocating is performed by associating a geographic location with an IP address.

D and E are correct according to https://community.cisco.com/kxiwq67737/attachments/kxiwq67737/4436-docs-data-center/939/1/technote-apic-findgeolocationusingsnmp_01x.pdf

I think B+E are correct. Geolocation is not Mobility, so this has nothing to do with IP-Ranges.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/aci/apic/sw/4-x/aci-fundamentals/Cisco-ACI-Fundamentals-401/Cisco-ACI-Fundamentals-401_chapter_0100.html

choices.D: Geolocation is performed by associating a geographic location with an IP address.
choices.C: Geolocation policies are configured under Fabric > Access Policies
choices.E: Geolocation is the identification of the real-world geographic location of a networking device.
choices.B: Creating a geolocation policy involves creating a site, building, floor, room, and row.
choices.A: Geolocation policies are dynamically configured in ACI using the site address field in the spine and leaf Type-Length Vector frames exchanged during the initial LLDP process.

questions.question_text: Which two statements about geolocation policies in the ACI Fabric are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: ok, got it, A is correct
whats the difference between A and C ?
And when you look to the very similar Q202, there the answer with the Port Type E is correct.
B is correct. This is a PortChannel between 2 FC Switches and therefore the PortMode can only be E or TE.

NP:
Port channelingâ€”Interfaces can be channeled between the following sets of ports:
E ports and TE ports
F ports and NP ports
TF ports and TNP ports

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit. An administrator must configure a SAN port channel between a Cisco UCS and a MDS switch as shown in the exhibit.
//IMG//

The UCS fabric interconnects are in FC switch mode. The administrator creates a port channel on the MDS switches with the configuration. After performing a "no shut", the interface does not come up.
Which configuration change is needed to bring up the port channel?

choices.C: Cisco UCS port configured as storage
choices.A: switchport mode NP on the port-channel interface
choices.B: switchport mode E on the port-channel interface
choices.D: Cisco UCS port configured as FCoE uplink
